column1: {{quote|They are as ice and glass and steel
column2: being above all imagination of the [[Elves|Children of Earth]] cold
column4: and hard. They cannot be seen
column6: save by the [[Door of Night]].|[[Rúmil of Tirion]]

column2: pron. {{IPA|[ˌiluˈrambar]}}) is a term mentioned in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part One]]'' and is a [[Qenya]] name for the '''[[Walls of the World]]'''.<ref name="bolt">{{LT1|IX}}</ref> Earlier it was called the '''Wall of Things'''.<ref>{{LT1|IIIn}}</ref>

the Walls are a shell that fence [[Vaiya]] and the world from emptiness and darkness (the [[Void]]). The World and all its airs are globed inside them. They are totally impervious and their only opening is the [[Door of Night]] which is guarded by [[Earendil]].<ref>{{SM|Ambarkanta}}</ref>
